channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.description:

  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFICATED PERSONNEL INFORMED OF DISTRESSED PACKAGE. SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW, NOTED LIQUID RELEASE CONTAINED TO PACKAGE. DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET AND UPON INSPECTION, THE SIDE WAS CRACKED WHICH ALLOWED LEAKAGE TO HAPPEN. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: BOTTLE EMPTY

item.title: Report E-2023070793
item.description:
Report E-2023070793

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: GALLIPOLIS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 7, 2023, three (3) 5-gallon pails of acetone were dropped due to mishandling and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surface. TLE noted that the material had hardened to the dock floor. The crew utilized acetone and hand tools to removed the product from the dock floor. All damaged pails, impacted absorbents, and product were contained in two (2) 35-gallon drums of waste. Following approval from the onsite contact, TLE secured the waste for delivery to the R+L terminal in Wilmington.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023070990 SequenceEvent: The package was taken out of system flow due to noted spillage, upon inspection of inner contents, one of the cans was damaged during processing causing spillage, due to the spillage the rest of the contents inside the package was soiled. DescribePack: Crack container/body. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package and contents were placed in a lined hazmat tote to mitigate spillage. 2. X-2023070997 SequenceEvent: CERTIFICATED PERSONNEL INFORMED OF DISTRESSED PACKAGE. SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW, NOTED LIQUID RELEASE CONTAINED TO PACKAGE. DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: BOTTLE WAS CRUSHED FORCING LIQUID TO ESCAPE FROM CAP DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: BOTTLE WAS PLACED RIGHT SIDE UP TO MITIGATE SPILLAGE

  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFICATED PERSONNEL INFORMED OF DISTRESSED PACKAGE. SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW, NOTED LIQUID RELEASE CONTAINED TO PACKAGE. DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: BOTTLE WAS CRUSHED FORCING LIQUID TO ESCAPE FROM CAP DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: BOTTLE WAS PLACED RIGHT SIDE UP TO MITIGATE SPILLAGE

item.title: Report X-2023061329
item.description:
Report X-2023061329

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-08
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 8, at the LCKR station reported a package that had zero markings on the outside indicating there was dangerous goods inside. The package fell off of the conveyor belt and opened up, causing the inside receptacles that are marked as a non-flammable gas to be viewed. There was no release of the gas contained in each cylinder. DG Admin instructed the station to hold the shipment until further disposition.
